problem_text:
The dimension of a partially ordered set ⟨P, ⩽⟩ is, by definition, the least cardinal number δ such that the relation ⩽ is an intersection of δ relations of linear order on P. Is it true that, for any Chernikov group which does not contain a direct product of two quasicyclic groups over the same prime number, the subgroup lattice has finite dimension? Expected answer: yes.
L. N. Shevrin
